caption: I was lucky to see the exhibitions of Josh Sperling and Takashi Murakami at the same time. There is always interesting exhibitions and well-known artists.

I found myself very bad with this online store, they didn't help me at all by accusing me of ruining a print, so I had to pay to return it and to get it back. an experience that I don't recommend to anyone.  Be very careful with these people if you don't want to have very big problems.
JULIO LE PARC - BIFURCATIONS. Shown for the first time, these works create a dialogue with the historical paintings, sculptures and installations from the 70’s to the 90’s.
Beautiful, quiet space with "major" artists shown here. An excellent (free) spot to visit if you like contemporary art. Information pamphlets are in French and English.
I visited when Murakami exhibition was on. A great contemporary art gallery to add to your travel itinerary or weekend agenta at zero cost.
As the exhibitions changes all the time, do read up on their website before visiting. Definitely a must see for any art lovers.
Always amazing to see current exhibitions. High level of production, best artists and a beautiful venue.
I had the pleasure of visiting Perrotin Paris, loved it,as an artist would love to have an exposition there,beautiful gallerie,recommend to anyone visiting Paris,do not miss a visit
Contemporary art, Pharrell Williams have done shows in this place Otherwise you have very fun shows and cool opening
Such a nice staff in the store! Beautiful art in the gallery. This is a must to do often!
A very nice place in le Marais. A special plus for the great help and intuition of Algae who works there .
Really nice gallery with contemporary art and good exhibitions !
One of the best art galleries in Paris , like a little contemporary art museum
Hidden gem. Contemporary art space within a charming Parisian exterior.
One of the must visit if you are in love with contemporary art
Classic, small Parisian art gallery set off a courtyard off the main street.
One of the top galleries in France, displaying international heavyweights from time to time.
One of the gallery that count in Paris but put some ashtray in the courtyard please!
One of the most beautiful galeries in Paris!
Amazing to people that love art & fashion!
There is always something to see at the famous galery.
Fabulous gallery, great shows
It was fine. Kinda small I think
Really nice people running the place.
Bloody cold.

A gallery in Paris that is well worth visiting. The exhibits and exhibition layout are very thoughtful, and the venue is also very good.

Much more than a gallery, this place has everything of a museum. The works presented are extremely well presented and benefit from an ideal environment. Extraneous requests are reduced to a minimum, which allows you to become absorbed by the works and explore them with complete peace of mind. Finally, the space available makes it possible to present grandiose works without them appearing cramped.
Visited on Wednesday April 18. Vast place. But the exhibition didn't interest me.

Gallery with free access and various works on display. The book store is very interesting where it is possible to purchase not only books but also memorabilia from very famous artists such as flowers by Takashi Murakami or scarves by the Italian Cattelan.

At the bottom of an old courtyard, a superb private mansion which is accessed by a double staircase... we appreciate the architecture and the serenity of the place... always exhibitions of contemporary artists... we like it or we don't I like less but this way we train our knowledge and our artistic taste by not wandering on 2 levels... it's free and no one asks you anything...

It's always interesting to go to galleries. This, with free access, offers a very nice selection. The place is superb and worth the trip alone. If you're in the area, don't hesitate to stop there. Also has a small bookstore with an interesting alternative selection.
My favorite gallery! The artists are exceptional and frequently renewed. If you are a fan of Takashi Murakami and contemporary art, go for it! Also ideal for taking photos.

The structure of the building itself and the handle of the indoor spiral staircase leading into the courtyard are unique and Parisian. I really enjoyed viewing the Takashi Murakami and Seobo Park exhibitions in a comfortable space.
Very nice gallery which is also free.
